newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Big buyer of Oracle, Cisco calls.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Big buyer of Oracle, Cisco calls.

text.p: One investor was a big buyer of two Oracle Corp and two Cisco Systems Inc call options Thursday, but traders said the strategy was unclear.
The Oracle May 40 call traded 6,120 contracts by about 1115 CDT/1615 GMT and the May 45 call traded about 5,100.
The Cisco May 50 call traded 3,200 and the May 55 traded about 4,225.
"We think it's the type of customer that could come in in the next day or two and just bang it right back out," Patrick Hamilton of LETCO said.
"One can only begin to speculate what's going on," he said.
Oracle shares were up 1-7/8 at 39-5/8 on turnover of about 4.5 million shares and Cisco rose 7/8 to 49-1/2 on 8.3 million shares.
Hamilton said Cisco has quarterly earnings scheduled for release in May, which could be one reason for the big call buys, but Oracle reports in June.
He added that volatility in the Cisco May calls had declined earlier this week to the mid-50 range.
"Starting Monday we had a lot of sellers in May," he said. Volatility "is at a level where it can trade. I do anticipate it going up."
Trading remained fairly busy in International Business Machines Corp options as the stock surged after the computer giant reported strong quarterly earnings late Wednesday.
Some of the heaviest activity was in the high-volatility May 135, 140 and 145 puts, said Jon Najarian, president of Mercury Trading. Volatility in those options was in the mid- to upper-30s.
Traders said investors were mainly selling the puts, which fell sharply as the stock rallied.
"Clearly there are a lot of people that had insurance that are now just ditching it, figuring they don't need it anymore," Najarian said. "Those are the high volatility options right now."
The IBM May 140 put traded about 5,200 contracts, the May 150 traded 3,100 and the May 145 put traded 2,850.
On the call side, the May 155 traded nearly 6,900 contracts and the May 150 call traded about 4,725.
IBM shares were up 10-5/8 at 153.
"There were a lot of doubting Thomases," Najarian said of investors who doubted IBM's earnings would be strong enough to boost the stock, which had recovered from 127-1/8 in early April.
"In fact, what happened was blowout earnings," he said.
In other trading, a sizable spread traded in options on Amoco Corp options.
The Amoco May 70 call traded 9,510 contracts and the November 75 call traded 4,405.
Amoco shares were down 5/8 at 82-7/8.
